p: AA is converted into LTB 4 by LOX activity. The LTB 4-BLT1 axis plays a key role in the development of inflammatory diseases including inflammatory bowel disease by stimulating the recruitment of inflammatory cells and the production of pro-inflammatory cytokines ( 18â€“ 20). LTB 4 also activates another receptor BLT2 which is a high affinity receptor for 12-hydroxy-heptadecatrienoic acid (12-HHT). In contrast to pro-inflammatory role of BLT1, BLT2-deficient mice show transepidermal water loss, suggesting its anti-inflammatory role in the skin ( 21). Indeed, BLT2-mediated pathway induced the expression of claudin-4 for enhancement of epithelial barrier ( 21).
